Package scenegraph

Class AbstCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • scenegraph.AbstSceneObject
      • scenegraph.AbstNode
        • scenegraph.AbstSpatial
          • scenegraph.AbstCamera
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ChannelInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PerspectiveCamera
    public abstract class AbstCamera
extends AbstSpatial
    Base class for camera handling. A camera is an object in the scene, which is not displayed, but which determines the perspective or orthographic view of the scene. The camera has a position (location), an orientation (up, direction, focus, right vectors) and clipping details (near and far clipping plane, aspect ratio). This class allows the manipulation of all these characteristics.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ursula Derichs

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstCamera

        public AbstCamera()
        Default constructor. The camera is positioned at the coordinate (0/0/8), looking along the Z axis and the Y axis being the 'up' vector. The Z range is set to [0.1,20].

      • updateTransform

        public void updateTransform()
        Transforms the camera vectors and positions locally (apply local transformation matrix consisting of translation, scale and rotation). The camera might be stand-alone object outside the scene or an object embedded within the scene.
